Hi Hagop,

Hope all is well

 

It’me again with hopefully the last insurance to verify.

This is the product liability insurance, which is requested by our 3PL partner (see the relevant section in the agreement).

 

Premises>

Considering we have goods to be picked up from brands warehouses and delivered to our Miami Warehouse (pick up is mostly from US locations and few are from Europe)

Considering we have deliver the goods via UPS and Fedex (which have a 30% rate of missing parcels and have a very expensive insurance)

Considering we ship also the goods from Dubai warehouse to final customer

 

I requested a policy insurance that could cover us from the moment the merchandise leaves the brand warehouse to the moment the goods are received by the customer

In light of this, please advise if the proposal is satisfactory or if we need to make any changes

Thanks

Eugenia

--------------------------------------------------
Hi Eugenia,

My understanding is that the current operation will involve:


*	
	    Importing merchandise from overseas
*	
	    Local sourcing as well
*	
	    3PL services, which will involve storage, picking, packing, and delivery


Also, I assume that the 3PL provider is not assuming any responsibility, or is assuming minimal responsibility, while the products are in their possession.

*	
	    Importing merchandise from overseas
*	
	    Local sourcing as well
*	
	    3PL services, which will involve storage, picking, packing, and delivery


Also, I assume that the 3PL provider is not assuming any responsibility, or is assuming minimal responsibility, while the products are in their possession.

I would appreciate it if you could provide some further information to assess how best to insure the operation.


*	
	    How many shipments do you expect to import from overseas (cost value)? Will it be only from Level Shoes UAE, or direct from suppliers as well?
*	
	    For overseas imports, how many do you expect per year, and what would be the maximum value per shipment that you might expect?
*	
	    Will the operations be purely distribution, or do you have plans in the short term for a dedicated physical store?
*	
	    Will you be selling or storing perfumes, or are the products mainly fashion items?
*	
	    Also, are there any short-term plans for e-commerce selling? If so, what percentage is expected to be the turnover from e-commerce in relation to the total turnover?
*	
	    Finally, is the full-year budgeted turnover (sales) expectation set at USD 5M correct?


Please feel free to correct anything where my understanding is incorrect and elaborate on anything I may have missed that is important to know.

*	
	    How many shipments do you expect to import from overseas (cost value)? Will it be only from Level Shoes UAE, or direct from suppliers as well?

*

*	
	    Also, are there any short-term plans for e-commerce selling? If so, what percentage is expected to be the turnover from e-commerce in relation to the total turnover?
*	
	    Finally, is the full-year budgeted turnover (sales) expectation set at USD 5M correct?


Please feel free to correct anything where my understanding is incorrect and elaborate on anything I may have missed that is important to know.

Once you provide me with the details, I’ll try to insure the business from UAE, as it will likely offer better coverage at a lower cost. In the event of a loss, Level UAE would be compensated and would remit the amount to you in turn. This would be the structure if there is interest from the insurance providers we work with.

One last thing: when would you ideally need the insurance to start?

Best Regards,
Hagop

Hi Eugenia,

 

My understanding is that the current operation will involve:

 

*	    Importing merchandise from overseas (BOTH FROM THE BRANDS AND DUBAI WAREHOUSE)

*	    Local sourcing as well YES

*	    3PL services, which will involve storage, picking, packing, and delivery YES

 

Also, I assume that the 3PL provider is not assuming any responsibility, or is assuming minimal responsibility, while the products are in their possession. PLS CHECK THE RELEVANT SECTION IN THE AGREEMENT – SECTION 14

 

I would appreciate it if you could provide some further information to assess how best to insure the operation.

Also, I assume that the 3PL provider is not assuming any responsibility, or is assuming minimal responsibility, while the products are in their possession. PLS CHECK THE RELEVANT SECTION IN THE AGREEMENT – SECTION 14

 

I would appreciate it if you could provide some further information to assess how best to insure the operation.

 

*	    How many shipments do you expect to import from overseas (cost value)? Will it be only from Level Shoes UAE, or direct from suppliers as well? BOTH FROM SUPPLIERS AND LEVEL SHOES UAE. FROM LEVEL SHOES IT COULD BE AN AVERAGE OF A SHIPMENT EVERY OTHER DAY. FROM SUPPLIERS, WE ANTICIPATE 4 TO 5 TIMES PER YEAR FROM EACH SUPPLIER. WE DON’T HAVE A LOT OF GRANULAR DETAILS, BUT COULD BE AROUND 7/10 SUPPLIERS. 

*	    For overseas imports, how many do you expect per year, and what would be the maximum value per shipment that you might expect? THIS RANGES FROM BULK ORDERS FROM THE BRANDS (30.000 TO 50.000 MAX, TO CROSS BORDER ORDERS TO FINAL CUSTOMERS… WE MIGHT HAVE 500$ VALUE OR 10.000/15.000 $ PER DAY IF WE CONSOLIDATE MULTIPLE ORDERS. IT IS VERY DIFFICULT TO GIVE YOU A CLEAR RANGE

*	    Will the operations be purely distribution, or do you have plans in the short term for a dedicated physical store? PHYSICAL STORE IN IN 2027

*	    Will you be selling or storing perfumes, or are the products mainly fashion items? NO PERFUMES. SHOES AND ACCESSORIES

*	    Will the operations be purely distribution, or do you have plans in the short term for a dedicated physical store? PHYSICAL STORE IN IN 2027

*	    Will you be selling or storing perfumes, or are the products mainly fashion items? NO PERFUMES. SHOES AND ACCESSORIES

*	    Also, are there any short-term plans for e-commerce selling? If so, what percentage is expected to be the turnover from e-commerce in relation to the total turnover? THIS IS AN E-COMMERCE ONLY OPERATION FOR NOW. SO SALES ARE 100% ECOMMERCE DRIVEN

*	    Finally, is the full-year budgeted turnover (sales) expectation set at USD 5M correct? YES

 

Please feel free to correct anything where my understanding is incorrect and elaborate on anything I may have missed that is important to know.

 

Once you provide me with the details, I’ll try to insure the business from UAE, as it will likely offer better coverage at a lower cost. In the event of a loss, Level UAE would be compensated and would remit the amount to you in turn. This would be the structure if there is interest from the insurance providers we work with. I AM NOT SURE YOU CAN CASCADE ALSO TO USA THE FULL COVERAGE.

I WANT TO MAKE CLEAR THAT WE WANT TO INSURE BOTH : ALL GOODS IN TRANSIT AND GOODS SITTING IN THE WAREHOUSE (NET OF THE INSURANCE PROVIDED BY OUR 3PL). CAN A UAE INSURANCE COVER SUCH RISKS IN A FOREIGN MARKET? 

 

One last thing: when would you ideally need the insurance to start? MERCHANDISE IS STARTING TO ARRIVE NOW TO THE 3PL FACILITY. SO THE SOONER, THE BETTER

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
